headline: Vote Is No Easy Choice for an Alabama Democrat
abstract: Mr. Jones, the lone Democratic senator from the Deep South, is in a precarious political position as he cautiously approaches impeachment in a state where President Trump is immensely popular.
lead_paragraph: MOBILE, Ala. — Senator Doug Jones of Alabama waved a stack of legal pads in the air — all of them filled with his notes from the opening days of President Trump’s impeachment trial — and insisted he needed to hear more facts. “Yesterday’s evidence was pretty compelling,” he said in a video posted to his Twitter feed last week. “So I’m anxious to see what the president will say and do.”
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
